title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the demand curve is unit elastic at the quantity of 15 units and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue is zero, or use numbers to explain that total revenue is maximized at this quantity or that the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is 1.

The response states that the demand curve is unit elastic at the quantity of 15 units and explains that the marginal revenue is zero, or uses numbers to explain that total revenue is maximized at this quantity or that the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is 1.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not explain that at 12 units marginal cost exceeds average total cost, which means that the additional cost of producing the next unit is higher than the average total cost, which pulls the average total cost up for the next unit.

The response explains that at 12 units marginal cost exceeds average total cost, which means that the additional cost of producing the next unit is higher than the average total cost, which pulls the average total cost up for the next unit.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 9 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $14 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

The response does both of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 9 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $14 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the deadweight loss at the profit-maximizing quantity as $9 and/or does not show the work.

Deadweight Loss =   1 2 ($14−$8)(12−9)=$9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@544A@

The response calculates the deadweight loss at the profit-maximizing quantity as $9 and shows the work.

Deadweight Loss =   1 2 ($14−$8)(12−9)=$9 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@544A@

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the profit-maximizing quantity will stay the same and/or does not explain that the increase in fixed cost does not affect marginal cost in the short run.
The response states that the profit-maximizing quantity will stay the same and explains that the increase in fixed cost does not affect marginal cost in the short run.
